text:
Appearance: high clearness, present foam,clear golden colour 
Aroma: malt and hay, honey, herbal, a little bit of citrus
Taste: sweet starting and a pleasant final bitterness
Palate: light body, great carbonation
On tap at BGH. pours a crisp clear amber. Little on the nose. Light bodied with some slight hop flavor. Smooth and crisp. Refreshing.
-On tap Haandfest 2017 Drammen- Everlasting white head. Grain and floral. Crisp, refreshing and green hoppy finish.

On tap at Haand Festival. An unclear yellowish golden colored beer with a white head leaving lacing. The aroma feels a bit sweetish, with pale malts, grass and notes of hay. It has a decent bitterness in the mouth, its close to full-bodied, nicely carbonated and with flavors of pale malts, grass and some hay. Long finish. Not very pilsner-ish this one, but its a fine brew for sure. 160528
Tap at Sori Taproom, Helsinki. Colour is clear golden with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Grain, dryness, minerals and malts. Clear and clean but cant find anything special in this one.

Bottle, BB 08.2017 (from UJH). Pours golden with whiteish head. Aroma is spicy, clove, hoppy. Flavor is sweet and bitter, dry hops, malt, more spiciness. Finish is dry bitter. Overall: well balanced and well made, but not really my kind of pilsener.
Tap @ Rbabarrab. Pours clear golden with a medium white head. Aromas of crisp pils malts, citrus, floral. Taste is pale malty, citrus, biscouits, floral, light bitter finish.

Tap. Clear golden color. Medium size, white head, stays. Grainy, herbal hops, grassy, sweet in aroma. Grainy, herbal hops, grassy, perfume in taste. Perfume and herbal hops in aftertaste. Crisp carbonation. Nice spicy feel of hops in mouth. Solid brew.

On tap at Pudel, Tallinn. Clear golden with a modest, white head. Mild malty and slightly fruity and herbal aroma with grassy notes, hints of citrus and dough. Moderate sweet with fairly mild flavours, but a nice bitterness. Balanced, easy to drink and quite refreshing. Certainly a decent pilsner!

Un equilibrio che si realizza tra il malto e il luppolo, molto evidenti ma perfettamente integrati.
In bocca è una carezza morbida ma anche vivace e piena di fragranti profumi che risalgono fino al naso.
Ha un gusto fresco.

S: hops, malt, floral A: light yellow, clear, creamy head T: med sweetness, light bitter finish P: lively carb, easy to drink 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Light yellow to golden, slightly hazy with medium white head and good lacing. Typical pisner hoppy aromas with some sweet citrus tones, very pleasant and refreshing. Light to medium body, little bit sweet but with very low bitterness... Good, refreshing and very drinkable but bitterness should be higher.
Clear shinny pale golden with a nice white head. Aroma of hay and herbs. Beatiful bittersweet balance with a gentle bitter aftertaste. Superbly balanced yet tasty and moreish, truly excellent.

From 32GP. In Teku glass. Afte dinner. Very grassy and herbal, more malty than usual in the style, with a bigger body. I have the feeling than drinking more units will make it much more appreciable for me

This beer is Donald Trump and Nigel Farages nightmare. Its a testament to how good globalization can be: a German pilsner, made by an Italian brewery, with the hop schedule of an American Pale Ale. It doesnt have time for your petty style guidelines, and its delicious,

W aromacie kwiatowe, cytrusowe, wyjatkowo intensywny jak na lagera. Piana sredniopecherzykowa, utrzymujaca sie. W smaku bardzo gladnie, czysty lagerowy profil. Delikatnie cytrusowe, goryczka niestety niska. Wysycenie dosyc wysokie, w stylu. Fajny pils, zabraklo goryczki.
Golden with a white head - Malt aroma with some hop with citrus - Malt body with citrus hops - The malt and hoppy citrus goes into the finish with some bitterness - This was crisp and refreshing

330ml bottle. Pours golden yellow colour. Medium white head. Slight hints of citrusses, hints of malts, grassy and bitter notes in the aroma. Grassy and citrussy notes and malts in the taste. Slightly bitter, grassy aftertaste. Light bodied. Medium carbonation. Very well balanced, refreshing, extremely drinkable brew. Very good brew.
Dorado limpio y espuma blanca. Aroma de pan cereal y ligero cítrico. Suave en boca con sabor como en aroma, regusto de pan y ligero sulfuroso.
Some noble hopes but not super interesting like baseball extra innings. Pours golden without much head or lacing. Light bitter finish with some sourness. Nothing special. Tap somewhere - old rating.

Keg Third of a Pint at The Bottle Shop, Bermondsey, London in Nov 2016 - Slightly hazed straw yellow in colour. Off-white head. Fair lacing. Malty; cereal and grainy malts, caramel. Hoppy; grassy hops. Fruity. Mildly bitter and dry malty hoppy throughout. (2016-11-05)

Botella del @Señor Lúpulo. Despacho de cervezas, Gijón 12/01/2017
BBD: 24/03/17 Color amarillo, sabor maltoso, caramelo cuerpo medio,

Bottle 33cl.
@ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, Spain.
A: Golden.
T: Malt, citrus, sweet, slightly hoppy.
Perfecta en su estilo, limpísima. Para mi gusto, un poco más de lúpulo noble en aroma la haría redonda.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Bottle, 3 months after bottling. Pours yellow, with a big creamy head. Aroma is zesty hops, with grass, and notes of citrus peel, as well as light malts with bread and honey. Medium body, with soft to average carbonation. Flavour is bitter zesty hops, with notes of pine, grass, hay and minerals, as well as light malts with bread and honey. Lingering bitter finish. No obvious faults on this, and quite possibly the perfect pilsner. Quaffable, refreshing and lovely!

March 25, 2016. On tap at Himmeriget. 
Clear golden with a medium sized creamy white head. Aroma is crisp and clean malty with grain, toasted bread, some floral, grassy hoppy notes and a mineral touch. Taste is light to medium sweet, soft bitterness. Crisp, light to medium bodied, yet slightly creamy. Smooth crisp malty light sweet finish with a light to medium smooth bitterness. 
Great, clean, crisp and very drinkable. ¨

Bottle @ gusto. Slight haze golden. Herbal grassy. Dust. Fine balance. No DIA dms. Super brew. Love to everything. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33 cl. tap. (Tamburin, Bologna). Hazy golden yellow with a frothy white head. Aroma is fresh grains with grassy hops and hints of citrus. Crispy! Balanced pleasant savory taste with light to medium sweetness and mild bitterness. Light-bodied with thin texture. Average carbonation and very pleasant finish (although not long-lasting). The best Pilsener (and possibly the best Lager) Ive ever tried. Kudos!

Bottle, outside on a sunny Sunday evening. Go me! Pours hazy golden with a white frothy head. Malty pilsner aroma with very pleasant light citrus fruity notes. Also pine nuts. Feels quite thin, but not watery. Quite lively. Abrupt. Quite bland, some bitterness, very balanced. I dont quite get the fuzz, Ive had more interesting pilsners.

0.33 bottle.   A delicately hazy, pale yellow color with a large, white head of good retention. Aroma of pale malts, citruses, honey, and flowers; hay and grass are quite noticeable too. Taste is delicately sweet: malts, grass, dough, hay, a tad of citrus. A medium body, a slightly creamy texture, and an average carbonation. Finish is medium long and also relatively sweet, it is partially differentiated from the rest by more buttery flavors. Overall the beer is great, one of the few examples showing that pilsners can be quite enjoyable despite their usual simplicity.
Pours hazy yellow with a medium white head. Aroma is a bit hoppy with some malts and grass. Taste has malts, some grassy hops and a medium bitter finish. Medium body and carbo.

Bottle from Boxbeer. 
Pours golden with a white head. 
Aroma of grain and straw. 
Bitter, balanced and clean. Quite big.

Bottle from Boxbeer. 
Intense yellow, white frothy head
Aroma of malt, hay, hint of honey.
Taste round, bitter, hint of hay. Fresh feel.
Balanced.
Solid pilsner, a backbone of earthy hoppyness, more demanding than most pilsners.

Keg at the brewery restaurant. A clear bright golden coloured pour with a lasting light white froth. Aroma is fresh grains, grassy spicy hop with a little citrus. Flavour is composed of pale grains, bread, delicate hop, hints of grass and straw. Very well balanced and sessionable. Palate is light and refreshing, with soft moderate carbonation. Very nice.

Servida de tirador en Ruzanuvol (Valencia). Cerveza de color pajizo, con una espuma blanquísima y persistente. En la boca es suave, refrescante y muy limpia. Es malta y nada más malta, bien tratada y con el lúpulo justo para tapar lo mínimo posible. Sabor complejo, seco en el primer trago pero que va destapando matices a medida que la saboreas. Algo dulce para una pilsen en pero una grandísima sorpresa. Muy aconsejable, le hace a uno acordarse de que no todo son IPAs.

330ml bottle from Boxbeers. Bottled 30.06.16. Pours golden orange with a small head. Aroma of sweetish floral notes, grass, hay, grainy malts and butter. Taste is crisp, grainy and floral with some grass, hay and citrus. Finish is crisp and earthy with some floral and grassy notes. Okay pils with an interesting hop profile.
Klar gulbrun med høyt hvitt skum. Lukter korn og noe sitrus. Lett. Noe bitterhet, korn og maltekstrakt i smak. Kort

Pils molto pulita e pienamente nello stile, forse solo la carbonazione doveva essere un po più elevata. Fresca e dissetante. Leggermente più amara rispetto alla media delle pils ma questo aiuta la bevuta. Laroma del luppolo lho percepito più sul finale che nel bicchiere.

Draught at Il Locale, Cph. Sligtly hazy, golden colour with a big, fluffy white head. Sweet aroma with grasses, pale malts, fruitiness. Taste is lightly bitter. Medium body with a creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes dry and bitter with hay, soft, butter like notes. Excellent Pilsner. Highly recommended.
From tap at Il Locale. Hazy dark yellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, fruit, hops, straw a a mild bitter finish.

33 cl bottle from Boxbeers. Pours golden with a nice thick white head.
Honey, grass, herbs, a bit minty on the aroma. 
Classic pils with a touch of hops. Very clean and nice tasting. Dry mouthfeel.
One of the best pils ive had.
Keg @ Fighting Cock, Cliviger. Golden-yellow with a thin head. Has a small floral-fruitiness, and its crisp. Lemon is dominant in both aroma and taste.

Draft @ Bootleggers CPH, 20 cl shaker

Pours straw-yellow with a decent head of foam that persists for a long time. Equal aromas of malts and hops with some fruitiness. Flavor in the same direction, leading to a pleasantly bitter aftertaste. 

Probably best, most balanced and most drinkable lager I have tried.
Yellow with lasting foam layer. Fruity hoppy nose with hints of salty sourness. Mild light hoppy taste. Calm and light milky aftertaste.
Tap at Erzbierschof Zurich. Hoppy grass aroma, flavour of citrus and a little pine. Light and dry and bitter, yet not thin. Highly drinkable. Nice!
Bottle.Golden colour with medium white head.Aroma is hoppy with good notes of grain and malt,fruity with fresh crispy mouthfeels and light finish.By style ok Pilsner.

Gezapft in Open Baladin in Rom. Gelber Körper, leicht trüb, starke Schaumbildung. Aroma Südfrüchte, Mango. Scharfer Antrunk. Chili, Zitrus, Grapefruit, bitterer werdend. Langer Nachgeschmack (Grapefruit)
Tap. Hazy yellow color with small white head. Aroma is citrusy, light, slightly herbal. Taste is yeasty, citrusy. Medium carbonation. Okay, but more a Landbier than Pils...
Grass, hoppy and malty, golden with a quite creamy white head, light body, medium carbonation, quite bitter, grass and malty...yes, a very good pils.
Clear pale blond colour with thick fluffy head. Soft carbonation and mouthfeel. Light malty taste.
Grass and hay hit the nose forst, then a gently sweet cereal malt. Flavor is a little hoppier than the norm, and it works here. Dry, lightly bittersweet finish.
Keg. Hazy golden, medium sized good lacing white head. Hay, grain, dry flowers, some fatness, minerals. Soft and filling carbonation, mild/medium sweet with fine bitterness. Short finish. Ok.

On tap at the Appalachian Vintners.
Lacks clarity but otherwise a fine looking pils, especially the white head.
Hints of honey and faint spices in the nose.
Very light body would be watery if not for the medium+ carbonation.
Mild flavor, to the point of being a light pils. No major flaws but seems distinctly less than world class.
Tap @ himmeriget. Clear yellow body with a small head. Perfume, malty, light hoppy.
Pours clear golden with a White head. Aroma of corn, malts, grainy, soapy. Taste is rather sweet, citrus, soapy, rwet grains. Light bitter finish. Not in best con.

Crowler, fresh, drunk 4/12/16, from Turdferguson. Thanks, man!Pours a lovely, bright, golden body. Sparkling clarity, with a thick white head that shows strong retention.Grass, mineral, herbs, biscuit and honey in the nose. Pretty much everything I want from a pilsner and nothing I dont. Theres no resin, the hops are certainly aromatic, but not overdone and theres no dough or metal. Very fresh and charming.Snappy and crisp, with strong attenuation, tons of fresh herbs and minerality and a pleasing honey-like maltiness that balances things well and leaves just enough body to keep things interesting and not over-dry. Tight carbonation, crisp on the end with light biscuit character. Little bit of seltzer-like note is the only thing I can find to detract, but otherwise this is a nearly flawlessly executed rendition of a no-frills, honest drinkin pils.

Look: haze straw yellow with yeast particles.

Aroma: starts with some boiled egg sulphur notes, after that it is clear grassy with some zest.
Taste: moderate to light bitterness with light sweetness.
Flavour: dusty grass, some malts, lemon notes like from home-made lemonade, light yeasty ethers.

Good.
It seems more like hoppy kellerbier rather than bitter.

Aroma and taste comprises grassy and delicate floral hoppy notes, doughy malts, some hay, straw, nice subtle light fruity lemon, minerals, lovely crispness, outstanding pils, could drink loads of this.
Draft @ EPCOT. Pours clear golden color with white head. Aromas of grass and cereal malt. Pilsner malt flavor with some grass. Light to medium body with lively carbonation. Nice.
Colore biondo, limpida, ampia schiuma bianca con bollicine. Aroma bello, malto e luppolo, erbaceo. Palato perfetto per una pils, appena amaro. Carbonazione media. Grande birra.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2016 On tap. Colore giallo chiaro con riflessi verdastri. Schiuma cremosa persistente. Olfatto maltato e caramellato, sentori di pane, molto soddisfacente. Carbonazione da flat a soffice. Aroma amaro piacevole, pulito, di luppolo fresco e di malto crespo, vivace e godereccio. Malti Pilsner e Caramel e luppoli tedeschi si sostengono con esaltante equilibrio e vigore. Meraviglioso palato maltato e belle note erbacee, lontane tracce di miele. Corpo medio e trama watery. Beva esaltante, pericolosamente scorrevole. Finale scaldato dallalcool che invita ad un nuovo sorso. Chiusura rapida e pulita, da grande pils, meno secca del previsto. Una birra molto armoniosa, estremamente ben fatta e di gagliarda freschezza. Difficile da battere nella sua categoria.
Poured a yellow color with aromas of grassy hops, and light malt. Flavor so are grass with some light citrus, mediocre but not the worst thing out there.

Draft 0.5l at Bir&Fud Rome Italy 03.12.2015.Taste with ippopotamo36 bro, Mortlach and cika Boban.Pour it golden color with small white head.Aroma typical Franconia region horse shit.Taste malty, smooth, perfectly balanced, so rich flavour and easy drinkable.Bravo

Supert krankupp på Circus 25.1.16 sammen med Ovesen. Etter en lang og hyggelig prat med bryggeren (og grunnleggeren) Agostino starter vi med denne før vi skal ta for oss de 11 andre. Klar lys gylden med tett skum som varer helt til siste slurk. Deilig aroma og smak av tyske edelhumler (som også er brukt til tørrhumling). Meget frisk og syrlig (citron og lime), og med en lekker bitterhet (furunål, gress og citrus) i ettersmaken. Dette lover godt for resten av kvelden!

From tap at Cirkus with JMD 25.01.16. Clear pale golden, Persistent white head and lacing. Fine aroma of noble hops and fresh grass. Noble hops and lemon and lime marmalade in taste. Very refreshing and exceptionally quaffable. Good bitterness lingering on, with fresh grass and pine shoots.
Pours from tap lemon yellow. Medium foamy white head. Aroma citrus floral. Palate slick, taste light sweet. Very easy drinking beer.
E sempre di gran lunga la miglior interpretazione italiana del classico stile pils. Immortale.
Hazy straw colour, light frothy white head. Aroma is citric and slightly earthy. Flavours of pine, spice, light sweetness offset by a decent amount of bitter hops. Really nicely balanced.

Bevuta diverse volte prima di votare. Volevo essere sicuro di trovarla in forma, ma purtroppo non riesco a capire il perché di tanto successo. Centinaia di tedesche meno blasonate sono decisamente meglio.
33cl bottle from Beer52.co.uk. Straw with a thick white head; grassy aroma; crisp with a grainy body and a grassy hop taste with a touch of spice. A classic pilsner.

Bottle. Cloudy yellow with a small head. Slightly carbonated with an initial sweet flavour that quickly fades. Reasonable but nothing like as good as most German versions of this style. My first from this brewery.

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2015 Bottiglia @ Simei 2015, Milano. Lintensità olfattiva è normale e la persistenza olfattiva è sufficiente. Il cappello di schiuma a bollicine medie ha una discreta resistenza con finale di merletti. Il liquido è limpido, di colore giallo dorato brillante.

Bottle from Beer52. Pours pale golden with a thin watery head. Aroma floral and grassy. Taste refreshing with wheat, hay and a slight lemony tang. Not strong in flavour but very drinkable and a lingering sweetness in the aftertaste.

Un ottima pils. Sui generis magari, ma anche no. Grano fresco, erba e sentori di menta, per un naso pulito ed elegante anche se non vastissimo. Cracker fragranti allingresso in bocca, una certa nota terroso ed erbacea, che sembra portare anchessa suggestioni balsamiche, quasi di menta, e finale pieno di erba secchissimo, che pulisce la bocca. Media la Carbonatazione, snella senza mai diventare acquosa, al palato da una grandissima sensazione è sembra poter scendere giù per delle ore. Biondo chiarissimo, limpida, con una schiuma bianca pannossa discretamente persistente. Dissentate, direi ottima

Bottle from beer52. Very clear pale with a silky white head. Aroma is banana and a bit wheaty. Taste is dry and bitter a bit sweet too. Prickly and thinnish. Really nice tasty pils, the bottle was really annoying though, a proper struggle to open.
Nice mildly hoppy beer. Limited aroma but good medium taste. Slightly tangy on the palette.

Bottle. Pours a clearish golden yellow with a lasting white foamy head. Aroma of citrus, biscuits, brown sugar, lime. Taste is of citrus fruits, grassy, biscuit, bready. Medium carbonation, light oily mouthfeel.
Tap. Pour is gold with a frothy head, aroma is grassy. Taste is earthy, malty, minimal bitterness. Very nice
Really nice hoppy pilsner. Citrusy, grassy, medium bitterness, crisp and malty. Very good.

400ml on-tap at Il Santo Bevitore, Venice (7):
This one was an odd beer, it seemed quite refreshing & was fairly easy to drink with plenty of floral & citrus flavours but Im not entirely sure its one that Id go hunting for. There was a nice balance between the sharp citrus flavours & the pilsner type malts but in truth there wasnt a whole lot else going on with the beer, enjoyable in the sun whilst in Italy but its not a classic.

Spina. Colore biondo chiaro, schiuma bianca poco persistente. Aroma che mette in evidenza malti e luppoli, il tutto in maniera decisa e ben bilanciata. Gusto molto gradevole e bilanciato in bocca, dove i luppoli garantiscono un amaro molto dissetante e per niente stucchevole. Corpo leggero, molto fresca e rigenerante, carbonatazione adeguata. Non sono un grande estimatore delle Pilsener, ma questa è davvero di livello ed estremamente piacevole da bere.
Profilo aromi interessante. Birra secca ben luppolata, con abbondanti luppoli nobili in dry hopping. Leggeri sentori di miele, maltato in evidenza ma non invadente. Ottima birra

Keg @ The Salthouse, Galway [270815]
Light straw, slight haze, bubbly white head that dissipated
Aroma of light sweet malts, soft peppery notes, slight citrus, soft lemon
Taste of fresh soft light citrus, slight floral, delicate flavours, soft bit peppery bitterness, well put together, flavour quite unique for a lager
Palate - Medium carb, medium light body, soft bitter citrus, clean, fresh. Finish as main flavour, refreshing, a bit dry, peppery edge.
Overall - One of the very best Pils Ive tried - but very expensive on tap here.

BOTTLE 75 CL. BB 10-OCT-2015. Hazy pale yellow to greenish, white head. A touch of sulfur stays there for a minute. Classic german hop aroma - flowery and lemony to grassy. The taste has those same notes of hops (despite, not very powerful), delicate honey sweetness and a light but clean and crisp bitter finish. The body is on the thinner side. And the light but prickly carbonation gives it a rustic kellerbier-like feel. Really solid, even though the bottle was not fresh at all.
UPDATED: AUG 16, 2015 Aspetto giallo brillante, trasparente, bella schiuma compatta e persistente. Fresca, con buon aroma di malto. La migliore pilsner italiana.
On tap. Pours clear golden with a beautiful thick white head. Aroma is sweet malts, light honey, noble hops. Typical pils flavor, good dry hoppy finish.
Draft at King Arthur, Rome. Pretty prototypical pils, gorgeous white tall cream. Great mild pils, honey, a little layering sour. Served a little warm, this is a tasty beer.

finalmente lassaggio della tipopils! profilo aromatico entusiasmante! leggero,luppolato,gradevolissimo..chiara con un cappello di schiuma fine,filtratissima e trasparente..gusto anchesso lievemente maltato e con punte di amaro che domina leggermente di più sul malto..corpo scarso,finale secco..perfettamente in stile..ottima
40cl @ tap. Pur non essendo per nulla il mio tipo di birra, questa Pils riesce nel suo intento: dissetare.

Tap at Tutto Gusto Wine Cellar at Epcot. Clear gold with a white head. Aroma of grass, straw, and flowers. Taste is grainy malts and decent bitterness. Light-medium bodied and a little bit dry. Pretty good.
Tulip at Catania, clear golden frosty pour, nice short foam, lots of new wet hay and wild flowers, has perfect balance of bitterness, crisp finish
On tap at Craft Beer Bar Marciero. Pours out straw color topped with a small white head. Nose is grassy hops some grain and a little spice. Taste is more of the grassy hops and spice.

Bottle. 5.2%. Best before 24.05.15. 10 cl. sample. Pours a slightly hazy, pale yellow with a white head. Dryish, hoppy aroma with a cereal note. Flavour is sweet, with hops and cereals, dusty and a bit fruity. Dry finish. Palate feels a bit watery. Overall so-so; too much cereals. 01.05.15.
At Pisacco. Bottle pour. Pale yellow. Solid head. Really subtle nose. Grassy, light hops. Pleasant. Medium to light body. Crisp. Full flavor without reaching out of style. Great.
VBC 2015 Unclear yellow of color with a white head. An aroma of sweets, sugar, weak hops. A flavor of hops, grass, malt and bread.
Bottle at VBC. Pale yellow. Herbal and fruity aroma. Hoppy flavour a bit malty. Good, but quite ordinary.

Bottle share at VBC. Pale yellow, slightly hazy with a big white head. Hoppy aroma, smells like noble hops. Medium full body, not exactly to style. Good hop flavour, decent bitterness. Very nice beer, but not a usual pils.
Hazy yellow colour, fresh hops and goof bitterness a little bit too long, but really nice to drink again and again
Frothy white. Very clean hoppy mouth grassy. Very well balanced. Nice clean grassy finish. Very nice.
Bottle. Golden, clear with a min white head. Aroma of malt, hops. Medium bitter, dry malt end. Old notes

Draught @ Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà. Aroma is rather soapy with citrus and grain . Flavour has apricot, grass, some grainy malt and fruitiness. Also some odd menthol tones. Crisp, grainy and fruity, not your typical pils.
Tap @ venuti. Pours clear pale golden, white head. Herbal hops, grains in the aroma. Butter, herbal hops in the flavor.
taste2015 amara, delicata, ammaliante, degustata alla spina. come sempre un pilastro della produzione italiana

Tap. Friends of Ham, Leeds. Clear gold. Glossy topped, white head. Grainy malts. Lemon. Cut grass. Taste is clean dry. Crisp, sharp, dry palate. Grassy dry finish. Could drink large quantities of this!

Draft at Redlight Redlight the night before RBWG 2015. Clear straw yellow with off-white head. Aromas of corn, sweet malt, light lemon citrus. Tastes of wheat, malt, lemon citrus, herbs, spice. Light body with a dry finish.
Tap at Gar Eden. Aroma is bit plastic, light lemon and wheat. Bit Belgian. Taste is nice enough. Little bit sweet, fruity, not so grainy. Nice.
On tap-thin white-yellow/pale yellow. A-grassy, lt malt. T-grassy hops, lt malt/grain.
75 cl bottle. Hazy yellow colour with white nice head. Fresh floral hop aroma, sweet malt. Fresh hop bitter taste with dry finish. Great one
это пиво очень вкусно. я бы, конечно, рекомен& его всем. пожалуй& обратит& его. очень хорошо!
L578. Birra color giallo limpido. Al naso aroma di luppolo fresco, floreale, di buona beva.

On tap at Ma Che Siete. Served in a footed pilsner glass. A cloudey honey gold with a big thick head of foam. Lovely crackery malts + herbal spicy hop nose. The taste was bitter bitting fresh hops, crackery light malts & a crisp finish. A great progressive pils, wonderfully fresh.

Tap at Maxs Taphouse. Pours clear gold with a medium, creamy white head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is sweet Pils malt, light corn notes, cherries and strawberries with spicy and herbal hops. Flavor is sweet malt, berries, herbal hops and light bitterness with a dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.

Slightly hazed gold pour and a white head. Aromas of cereal grains and yeast. Delicious and complex for a pils. Cracker malts and floral continental hops over some faint honey sweetness. Light mouthfeel. Great pils from the Mediterranean.
Poured clear golden with a frothy white head. Aroma of bitter hops and sweet malt. Light to medium body, flavour is lightly sweet, medium bitter.
Draught @ Hoppy Days. Clear pale golden color, medium sized white head. Smell and taste malts, lightly hops, lightly bitter. Average body, soft carbonation.

0,33 l bottle from Biervana 
bread, hay, cereal, grass, citrus, golden, hazy, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, slick feel, average carbonation,

Bottle shared at Hoppy Days. Pours near clear golden with a white head. Aroma of floral hops, light grass, grain and fruits. Flavour is light sweet and moderate bitter. Light to light medium bodied with moderate carbonation.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2014 75 cl bottle, teku glass. Just shared with my dad and a beautiful piadina. Pours a low/medium head, which doesnt stay there for long. As soon as you approach the glass youre wrapped in a really sublime hoppy, resiny, strawy, papery, almost honey and floreal aroma. This thing smells crazy considering its a pils! The initial taste is an exact smell propagation, with a great floreal fresh,  which gradually transforms into that typical, but very well balanced, hoppy-bitter lasting flavour. Loong, tasty, but delicate finish.This goes perfectly with any panini, pizza, bready-pasta dish.. Theres no other such perfect, and better quality brew to match to your lunch/dinner. A real "birra da tavola" ("table beer"), as we would say in Italian, but in a gourmet style. Fully approved, never tiring (would drink liters...), should be always in the fridge, best easy going blond.------ Update -----  had quite some others, especially On Tap (@Solobirra). Always one of the really best in its category. I found the draught one a bit more easy-going for obvious reasons (mainly aroma, crispness), so I suggest you should try at least once this in a fresh bottle. But HeY... Still probably one of the best pils/lagers/blondies on draught you can find out there

On tap at Dutchs. Mostly clear golden color. Thin white head. Leaves good, thicker lace. Good bready aroma, and peppery flavor. Lightly musty, like the flavor I associate with older hops.. I was expecting a lot for such a highly rated pilsener, but this doesnt really blow me away so far. Medium-plus body. Smooth, kind of soft, lighter carbonation, and a very dry finish (too dry?). Moderate to bigger bitter taste, minimal sweetness. I was skeptical about this the whole way through, but towards the end, as it sat and warmed up a bit it really started to grow on me. Good lightly hoppy longer aftertaste is worth savoring.... Sigh... Was around a 3.2 for this initially, reluctantly raised it to a 3.5 over the course of ~12oz. Gets pretty good damn good after sitting for 30-60 minutes. More sweetness comes out, less dryness, and more pilsenery bready malt to grab on to. Not worth paying premium price for this more than once, though.
Light gold with a big, fluffy white head. The nose is light sweet cereal grains, some honey. The taste is clean light grains, hints of honey. Bread. Basic but clean, lovely. Good texture. Nice.

330ml very dark glass bottle. Filtered. Present from Piers. Clean and firm yet dry pale lager with moderate hops. Pleasantly tasty, though lacking interest or delight. 
I wasnt aware of the esteem Ratebeerians held this beer in, and Im somewhat surprised at the acclaim this simple, plain beer is getting. But each to their own - and much of the joy in drinking beer, is in drinking the provenance. I get excited when drinking beers that have a historic significance, such as Courage Russian Imperial Stout, and I understand that many people get excited when drinking beers that are currently popular on RateBeer.

Beer connoisseurs will repeat it has been better, but anyway Tipopils has gained the strength of a classic; there may now be better example of Italian pils, even if I might guess they are not too many, but I will always gladly return to this.

Bottle. Slightly hazy deep golden with medium white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops and grass. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, grass, medium bitter and a little dry.

I expected something more from the best  "Classic German Pilsener" on RB. Light golden body with a lasting small white head. Aroma is too hoppy to be "Classic German", lacks the usual grassy  and malty notes. I was truly disappointed. I think a "normal" Radeberger does a better job
Grassy floral aroma, golden hazy colour with a white lacey head. Dry, hoppy and floral flavour, slightly citrusy, with a nice bitter finish. Well balanced and very drinkable!

Half from tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fa. Slightly hazy, golden body. Lasting, low white head. Elements of lemon and apricot to the nose. Soft tropical fruits in flavour added by honey sweetness, lightly spiced. Smooth, dry hoppy ending. Well blended pilsener with great drinkabililty (Roma, 30.03.2012).
Molto fresca e beverina, amara il giusto.profumi di erba e spezie, pepe e fiori bianchi

Draught at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fa. Lemony hop nose. Malts are light. Pale gold with a nice, tall head. Crisp, grassy hop flavor with light, crackery malts and a clean, bitter finish. Lovely. An excellent drinker with a perfect body.

Birra che trovo complessa per lo stile!colore dorato schiuma bianca e persistente.al naso erbe luppolo fresco ma ci ho ttovato qualcosa che non mi convinceva qualche sensazione un po "sgradevole".in bocca domina lamaro ma anche malto erbe e una nota floreale e agrumata.carbonazione media .buonissimo retrogusto amaro e mediamente secco.
Una birra che mi ricorda molto il prosecco
On tap at BQ, Milan. Pours pale yellow with a small white head. Smells boiled vegetables. Tastes watery malty and abit grassy hoppy with a similar finish.

Mi piacciono molto le pils, ma questa ha davvero poco a che spartire con esse. Ha una luppolatura differente, il malto non si sente nemmeno, è ipercarbonata, non ha nemmelo la limpidezza di una pils. Una buona birra lo è sicuramente ma definirla pils mi pare sbagliato.

E la miglior pilsner su ratebeer e si sente...schiuma di media persistenza, colore di un giallo torbido. Allolfatto non si percepisce molto ma non appena in bocca sprigiona un ottimo gusto floreale e fruttato. Buon amaro che abbinato ad una gradazione poco elavata, la rende una birra di facile beva.
Che dire, alla spina non riesce mai a stancare, lascia sempre un profumo di luppolo e una grande voglia di berne unaltra

9/5/11 notes: Draft; Matched expectations. Pefumy, herbal presence. Body is soft, refreshing, fluffy, semi-dry on the finish. Incredible Sauv Blanc quality, perfumy, delicate, herbal, kiwi notes. Delicious drinker here, glad I got to try it!

Sat in the glorious sunshine outside Ma Che Siete on MesandSims epic stag do. First beer of the weekend. Treat! The best pilsener Ive had for sure. Great aroma with a hint of spice and a bit of grass and straw.Flavour is grassy, lovely and clean and refreshing, balanced nicely by sweet malts. Really enjoyed this.

Growler fill from the Birch Bar, Norfolk, VA.  Ive been hunting this one for a while.  Clear golden straw with a lacy white coating.  Nose is pear, light lemon and apple; fresh and fruity.  Crisp medium light, a touch resiny, perhaps softened a bit from a few days in the growler.  Taste is sweet green apple, white pepper, melon and honey finishing with a delicate grassy bitterness.  Sublime, another growler please.

On tap at BQ, Milan. Hazy deep blond color, clearer than usual, but with the same creamy head. The aroma is hoppy, medium intensity, grassy. Good malt and strong bitterness. Good, but nothing that special to me.

Draught at TJs:  Aroma of hay, light noble hops, slight citrus, slight herbs, and slight spice.  Poured yellow/gold in color with a small to medium-sized, creamy, dense, lightly rocky, off-white head that diminished but lasted throughout.  Hazy.  Not sparkling.  Very good lacing.  Flavor is slightly bitter.  Tastes of Pils malts, grass, hay, slight noble hops, and a hint of citrus.  Light to medium body.  Average texture.  Average carbonation.  Lightly bitter, hay, grass, slight lemon finish is lightly bitter.

(Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà)One of BIGGEST italian beer...very good example of style,good hoppy aroma,perfect balanced palate...excellent finish!
GOOD
Draft at the Birch.  Golden and sudsy-topped.  The aroma is almost floral.  Indeed this drinks with an almost lavender aroma, with a nice smooth mouthfeel (#4262,  9/24/2011)
La Tipopils comincia a perdere colpi, forse sarebbe il caso di non adagiarsi sul lavoro fatto ma di migliorare questo prodotto evoluto male

On tap at Churchkey. Nice hazy light golden pour with a small head. Aroma holds a delightful combination of big Hallertauer hop presence, grass, and earthy, spicy hops. Flavor brings more of that delightful hop presence, along with some nice crisp breadiness. Very nice.
This is just damn good. Grassy catty saazy hop nose. Crisp full biscuity malts. Fluffy pleasing mouthfeel, balanced finish. Golden with good head and lacing.
tap at birch and barley.    awesome fresh cut grass, herbs, fresh summer farm air.  leaves.  earthy.   super crisp.  dry.   rustic.  refreshing.   well made.  would drink all the live long day.

75 cl bottle from Beerhouse. Served into a flute. Pours a lightly hazy pale orange, with a big and fluffy rocky white head. Good lacing. Lots of grassy/floral hops and bready malts. Outstanding drinkability, the carbonation is spot-on and the bitterness is just perfect. Best pilsener Ive ever drinked.

75cl bottle from Domus Birrae, Rome
Thin but creamy white head.  Golden pour.  Very good for a pils.

Draft at Pizza Paradiso Dupont. Pour is a bright yellow with a small but lating white head. Aroma is lots of grassy and hearbal hops, lemon, biscuit, lager yeast. Flavor is soft, lightly sweet, with grassy hops and lemon with some light vegetal flavor. Palate is clean, high carbonation, and a lightly bitter finish. I think the journey across the Atlantic didnt do this one any favors, but still not bad.

Italian German Pilsner woot! Served on draft at Beer Run in Charlottesville, VA. Pours a hazy lemon yellow color with a large creamy white head. Good head retention and lacing. Aroma of pale malts and grassy hops. The taste is bitter grassy hops, some floral notes and pale malts. Thin bodied. A bit bland.

Bottle, slightly past due date. Aroma is bohemian hops, some cardboard.
Flavour is light bitter bohemian hops. Nice pilsener.

On draft at the most excellent bar ever, Churchkey DC. More like a Czech pils to me. Full-bodied and malty, yet quenching. The noble hop character is so.....noble! Lasting grassy, herbal hops on this finish. Sweetness is rather high for a German Pils, but thats just fine by me. With an OG of 15.8 plato and only 5.2% abv, no wonder its so syrupy sweet.

Pizzeria Paradiso Dupont, DC 120z tap ($4.50hh): Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a white head. Aroma is of hops to a greater degree than virtually any other pilsener Ive had. This is not to say that it is over-hopped, but rather that it has a nice aroma. Also, a good malt backbone is evident. So lets get to drinking. Bitter Germanish type hops pervade throughout. Not too grainy and not too sweet. Perfectly sessionable and perfectly balanced. Nice crisp mouthfeel. What a pilsener is supposed to be. Funny that it comes from Italy.
Bottle from GBBF, 2011, drank at home. Yellow-gold pour with a white head. Grassy herb aroma with a little light citrus. Citrus and light spice flavour. Dry, fruity finish.

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2011 Hazy gold with a lasting rocky white head. Nose is doughy with light grass, bit dry/floral. Flavor is soft cracker, lightly oily grass and dust, very dry through the finish, well balanced despite decent sized body. I dont get the lasting, complex grain finish I normally find in Victory pilseners, but its still quite excellent.

Aroma: malts, hops
Appearance: pale yellow
Taste: malts, hops
Palate: watery
Overall: 15/20

On tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fa.  Hazy yellowish in color with a large foamy white head on top.  Great grassy and floral hop aroma without too much of that annoying stuff called malt getting in the way (although to be fair, there is some).  Pale malt base with grassy and floral hop flavor and a touch of pepper.  Good bitterness.  Crisp mouthfeel with medium-light body and good carbonation level.  Let me tell you, this is one of the better beers that Italy is putting out there these days.  Worth a try if you want to see what theyre all about.
Una delle migliori Pils del pianeta! Profumata, Beverina e con un grandissimo finale!

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2012 Goldenyellow, big frothy head, unfiltered. Grass, light yeast, little earthy. Mild yet lots of flavour. Balanced start. Slightly bitter finish, but short. One of the pilsners Ive tried. (On tap at Bir&Fud) (Rating re-indexed)

Spina. Colore dorato con un bel cappello di schima. Profumi di erbaceo, campo ed una leggera albicocca. Ben bilanciata con un ottimo amaro. Luppoli e malti sono in gran equilibrio ed una carbonazione abbastanza alta la rendono fantasticamente beverina.

25/04/2011 Ma che siete venuti a fà (tap). Dorata intensa, abbastanza limpida, con abbondante schiuma biancastra, morbida e persistente. Aroma non molto presente ma ben bilanciato, si percepiscono malto e luppolo perfettamente equilibrati insieme. In bocca è un miracolo di equilibrio tra malti e luppolo, elegante, assolutamente non stucchevole. Una pils fatta davvero bene. Corpo medio, carbonazione generosa, molto beverina.

Tap at Ma Che Siete.. Light, slightly hazy yellow, massive rocky white head. Grassy, spicy aroma, canned fruits, apricots in particular. Loads of spiciness in the flavour. Semi dry. Nice and clean, good sessioner. Light bodied, busy but not harshly carbonated. Excellent pilsener.

Draft at Makke.  Boy, this one is every bit as good as everyone says it is.  Cloudy yellow color, massive ice cream cone head.  Aroma of white pepper and straw.  Clean, bright flavor and bitter finish.  Delicious.
Light. golden beer with a long living white foam crown. Rather faint but fresh smell of grass and resin. Good blanace between bitter, "green" hop tones and a medium sweet malt body. A good pilsner.
Talmente buona che non sembra vera. Fa rivenir voglia di apprezzare la vecchia e cara pils, oggi che impazzano le birre estreme e luppolate.

Questa birra lho bevuta alla spina e lho trovata fantastica, lho ribevuta in bottiglia e lho ritrovata fantastica. Colore classico con buona schiuma. Aroma superbo. In bocca è una pils perfetta, con un equilibrio ottimo tra malto e luppolo. Ma che volete da una pils, se non farsi bere a litri...

Very refreshing beer. This is the classic Italian Pils. I prefer the German ones, but this is a very good product. Very drinkable, bitter and fresh. This beer is always present at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà.
Alla spina al BQ (MI); ottima birra in stile ceco, la più fedele rappresentazione italiana di una pils

[3284-20100803] Bottle. Light straw aroma. Clear, bright yellow body with a long-lasting creamy white head. Generic straw flavour has light grassy notes. Light body is quite thin. Easy to drink but just light all around.
(@ GBBF 2010, London, England)
Colore giallo paglierino con una bella schiuma bianca e persistente. Profumi erbacei freschissimi e un equilibrio gustativo perfetto.

Taps @ Ma che siete venuti a fà, Rome. Pilsener elegantissima, dal colore paglierino vivo, leggermente torbido, con cappello di panna morbida. Al naso il malto si fonde perfettamente con il luppolo. In bocca leggermente acidula, con un retrogusto luppolato che si fa sentire pur senza essere mai eccessivamente invadente.

Tap. Great lacing and fluffy pure white head, great retention as well, on a mostly clear greenish yellow body. Nice, bright Pils hoppiness, mineral, earhty, and almost a bit of pine as well. Flavor comes through with a focus on the hops as well, mirrors the aroma. Not overly aggressive, but nice assertiveness.  Lean body, and some crackers.  Very soft, light body.  Beyond clean, refreshing, and damn tasty.  Fresh, and wish that I could access this regularly.

Meraviglioso profumo di luppolo fresco intenso e persistente.
Al palato sorprende con il sapore di pane fresco e un finale piacevolmente amaro.
Buona persistenza , non si vede lora del sorso successivo

Probably the perfect pilsener. I find here something similar to My Antonia del Borgo. Strong, clear  aroma of hops, spicy by herbs with some honey. Very balanced taste, medium bodied, very drinkable. A number1.

On draught at Ma Che Siete Venuti A Fa. Pours a dense yellowish gold with lasting fine bubble white head. Medium body but nice light (soft) mouthfeel. Crisp hoppy flavor soon overpowers the slight mustiness in the aroma. Reasonable hops presentation without overpowering off flavors.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2016 75cl bottle from De Molen shop.  Clear pale gold, thick lasting white head.  Best pils in the world?  It?s a tasty pils, just a bit of herb on the hop.  Very good body though.  Light creamy subtle hop aroma.  Yeast character on aroma is good.  Yes it?s good.  Better than Pilsner Urquell unpasteurised?  No.  Very tasty though.  Just a little bite on the finish.  Good, but not worth the ?15 I shelled out for it.  The Witzgall landbier Fin got me was better.  Decent yeast character. 3.6 /5. On tap at The Bottle Shop Bermondsey. After more exposure to lager i am in a better place to rate this now i think certainly upping the score. Yeast malt hop balance is excellent no doubt. Good biting hop on the finish.

From the Bottle at the GBBF, Earls Court 03/08/2010
Floral hop aroma. Golden coloured slightly hazy in appearance and hoppy with a hint of bitterness in a dry malt finish.

Draft at Redlight. This is sooooooo good. Wheaty gold pour with a thin white head. Musty hop citrus aroma. Taste is crisp bright malt with an assertive noble hop bite. Nice earthy hop finish. Just a damn good session beer.

2010-08-03. Bright pee yellow body with a nice white head. 3+ Flour hop aroma is mild and not helped by the pint glass. Light grassy character. 6+ Flavour is similar, floral hop profile, light bitterness throughout. 6+ Average to light bodied palate suits it. A well made pilsener that is not entirely to my own taste. Bottle at GBBF 2010

Alla Spina a Lurago. Holiday around Italy tasting and smelling beer! direi quasi strepitosa rispetto altri assaggi. naso enfatizzato da un profumo di luppolo intenso ma piacevole. in bocca perfetta, se devo proprio trovare un difetto solo il retrogusto viene assalito da quasto aroma  di luppolo in modo quasi invadente.. sembra di avere un pellets tra le mani di luppolo sbriciolato. anyway... all right!!!

Bottled @ Birroteca, Greve. Clear golden color, short head. Good hoppy aroma, bit flowery. Good bitter taste. Who would have thought the Italians would show how to make a decent Classic German Pilsner. :-)
Hazy yellow-whitish cover.  Aroma is light grainy, earthy, grassy hops.  Taste is pale malts, grassy, light husky.

Draught, Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà, Rome.

Head is mostly lasting.
Body is light to medium yellow.

Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), moderately hoppy (flowers, herbs, resin).

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter.

Medium body, watery/velvety texture, lively carbonation.

Mostly lives up to the hype.  Im not fond of the raw/resinous hop note, but its mixed in with other, more "noble" hop aromas so not a big deal.  Otherwise, just some toasty malt, appropriately so.  Great balance and a velvety smooth texture make it a joy to drink.  Good stuff.
Clear golden color/ lasting white head. Mild cinamon, pale malt, sweet corn aromas. Light mouthfeel. Nice pale malt flavors with some dry herbs, spices. good.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: On tap at Ma Che Sieto Venuti A Fa? It pours clear yellow with a medium white head. The aroma is quite fresh hoppy with notes of fruit and caramel. The flavour is clean and fresh. Caramel, fruit and hops. Bitter hoppy finish. Great balance.

Tap @ Ma Che Siete, Rome. Pours unclear yellow with a small creamy white head and lacings. Nose is fruity, grassy and yeasty. Citrus hops. Very grassy and dry flavor with a bit of buiscuit. Medium bodied. Very crisp. Nice

On tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà, RBESG Rome day 2. Hazy yellow colour, white head. Aroma of sweet honeyish malts, slightly dusty, flowery, light hoppy. Flavour is soft, light sweet, flowery, dusty, nice hoppy bitter finish. Smooth and soft mouthfeel. Good pils. Thanks Manuele!
750 ml bottle. Golden body with a fine white head. Aroma is malt and straw with grassy hops. Flavor is sweet malty, fruity and mild, balanced bitter. A nice, clean and tasty pilsner.
On tap from "ma che siete venuti a fa". Malty and hoppy aroma, fruity and hoppy flavor. Dry  long lasting finish. Very nice work.

Hell yes found this at 2 Amys! Super expensive for the glass but it was on tap so I had to try it after I saw someone give it a 5. Well, how good is this really? It pours a fizzy clear yellow with an ultra dense, thick, bright white head that sticks around ad infinitum and leaves the lace of God. Aroma is muted: grassy, white sugar, slight cocoa butter expounds worth. !? Taste at first sits in the mouth and dances around with subtle summer fruitiness and muted citrus. No characters in common whatsoever with most bottom-fermented beers outside of Czech Republic. Then all of a sudden, your palate gets a warp drive of drying, hoppy bitterness that rips away any trace that you just swallowed a liquid and leaves behind a dust trail of beautiful Saaz hops. More refined than Prima Pils and easier to love. This is a wonderful statement to the power of lager beers, which has been lost in the craft beer movement. This is the ultimate session beer that I would take over an Imperial Stout almost any day. You should try to find this on tap- because it will rock your world.

Assolutamente una delle migliori pils in circolazione. Bevuta da bottiglia,color oro, laroma è incredibilmente intenso per una pils con note erbacee e luppolate. Al palato è luppolo,  morbida, non troppo gassata, con grande bevibilità,  Il finale è secco con un persistente amarognolo. Una grandissima birra italiana.
I had this on tap at Beachwood BBQs Italian Beer Festival. Dry, crisp, clean, and easy to drink, this was a nicely  done beer.

Clear light golden witha  white head. Aroma og heather and honey. Taste is resin hoppy bitter, sweet and a bit acidic. Light to medium bodied. Watery texture.

Shared bottle @ Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours light straw coloured with a big white head. Nice aroma of grassy hops. Very crisp taste, dry, moderate sweet. Nice bitter end, true to style.

For sure one of my all-time favorite beers - it succeeds expectations in so many ways...Very refreshing and one of the most drinkable beers Ive ever tried.  Very well balanced, freshly hopped, thirst quenching beer.  A masterpiece...

0.75 l bottle at Helsinki Beer Festival. Golden color. Sweetish honeyish aroma with sulfur and tropical fruits. Sweetish malty flavor with crisp but not very strong bitterness, some herbal hops. Chewy mouthfeel, slightly astringent from hop polyphenols. Moreish. Quite tasty, but could be fresher.

On tap at Rustico in VA ($9/12oz?): Pours a transparent pale golden with a frothy, well-lacing pillowy white head.  Has a soft pilsener malty nose with a fresh, assertive peppery Saaz hop presence.  Starts with effervescent carbonation and mild sweetness with plenty of clean hop bitterness and zesty flavor before a drier, crisp, bittersweet finish.  Very true to style and drinkable, but the price prevents it from being a true session beer, at least here in the US.

750 ml stubby bottle, non-pasteurised, courtesy of Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 5.2%. Very pale yellow colour, big white head. Lovely aroma of flowery, herbal and fruity hops. The flavour is crisp and fresh with a moderate sweetness, herbal and floral hops throughout. Fine bitterness in the finish. One of the best pilseners Ive had.

Draught @ Moeder Lambic, Bruxelles. Golden coloured. Unclear. Small beige head. ARoma of herbs, fruits and some sweetness. Flavour as well herbal and light sweet. Has som flowery notes. Medium bodied. Has a sweetish bitterness in the end. Nice and easy going beer.

Draft at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Nice, resinous hoppy nose like sniffing a silver bag of hop pellets, but with backbone of toasted grain. Pale gold color with sturdy white head. Nicely bitter taste but that malt spine is right there, finishing light and dry. Tons of simple beery character and highly drinkable.
Clear golden with a medium off white head. Sweet aroma with malty and hoy notes. Flavour had plenty of hops, pine, graefruits and malty hints. Finished bitter. Notbad.
Bel colore quasi dorato, la freschezza percepita nel profumo si conferma in bocca. Finale abbastanza persistente. Molto piacevole.

Draught, BQ, Milan. Pale gold with a slight haze and a smallish white head. 
This isnt my favourite style, but the quality here is obvious and would give a hell of a lot of average german pils a serious run for their money. Nose and taste of grain and hops. Dry finish. UPDATED: MAY 7, 2017 Keg (Fa, Rome) (6:3:6:4:13=3.2)
Pale gold, slightly misty, and with a light head. Initially a pungent biting green hop aroma, almost nettly. Anna thinks its more piney. Crisp carbonation. Milky light grain palate. Rerate: Tap (Hell Hunt, Tallinn) (5:2:5:2:10=2.4)
Dafuq? This is just a pleasant vaguely hoppy malty lager.

Bottle.  Golden with a fluffy foam.  Aromas are biscuit and grain malts with floral grassy hops.  Some corn with nutty notes.  Flavours are peppery and dry with grain.  Caramel malts with grassy hops on the finish.  A very decent lager.
Bottle.  Golden beer with a light head.  The aroma is gently bitter, and the flavour is bitter and gently yeasty. Overall an average yeasty and bitter beer.

Bottled 750ml -Batch No 375. Slight hazy yellow coloured, small to medium sized white head, malty acidic nose. Moderate malty, dry grassy and mild hoppy with notes of hay and grapefruit. Short but very pleasant hoppy finish. Easy drinkable and very nice pils.

Draught at Ma che siete venuti a fa, Rome. Clear golden medium lasting head. Malty and grassy aroma, a bit of bread and yeast. Medium body, crispy due to carbonation, refreshing and dry. Nothing particular to be mentioned.
spina. non proprio una pils,come suggerisce il nome.delicata con buoni sentori floreali eun legero amaro finale .abbastanza persistente.comunque si lascia bere molto bene.

Bottle shared with tashi at my "All my US bottles from GBBF need drinking" tasting, 16th Aug 09. Hazy light amber with a persistent white head. Very strong pils hops aroma - you can smell it several feet away when its poured! Great flavour - loads of noble hops with a light grassy note. Clean finish with the sharp hop flavours persisting. You do get the peppery liquorice flavour they mention. Bit of fruitiness too. My first thought on finishing my glass was "Where can I get some more of this?" The bottle is superb as well.

(Bottled, 0.75l, BBE 17-02-10) Slightly hazy golden with a smallish, frothy and lacy head. Herby-grassy-hoppy nose with a touch of honey. Flavor is herby, flowery, grassy and very aromatic. Nicely balanced bitterness with a dry, hoppy bite in the finish. Light to medium body, medium carbonation, refreshing. A nicely aromatic, well-balanced and reasonably complex pils.

My flippin god, this is the pils.

Long lasting head, slightly hazy, deep gold in color.
Great nose, you get the sensation that youre "flying in hop clouds" (cit. henrik)
incredible intense palate, sharp and tasty, complex and balanced. Wow what a beer. What a finish!! 
Lovely, Bravo Agostino!!

Draught at Københavns Øldage 2009, Valby. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small white head. Fruity malty grainy crisp hoppy aroma. Malty grainy hoppy flavor with some hints of citrus. Has a dry malty grainy crsip hoppy finish.
A Mes rate. Bottle at GBBF.Excellent clean gold with a pillowy white head. Full on sharp fruity hoppage all round. Crisp, clean dry and drinkable. A proper pils and a bloody good one.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2015 draft at the brewery.  bright gold body, clear, underneath a rocky and firm white head.  perfumed minerally nose, snappy and zesty gravel-tinged saaz-like hops.  zesty, snappy, sharp crispness combined with a medium-light body.
 update 2015: overly grassy and sharp, stark and butter and it takes far too long for the toasty malt to show up.

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2012 Bottle sample at a tasting at Rotems place, thanks DSG, pours an hazy yellow with a nice head, aroma of malt, wheat, herbs, black pepper, floral tones, flavor is bitter with black pepper, herbs and light roasted tones, some herbs, medium bodied, quaffable  7/4/8/3/14[3.6] 

From tap @ BQ Birra Milano, golden yellow with a medium head, acidic aroma, some cheese and some olives, flavor is quite unbalanced and very perfumy,vinous and lemon tones, with a bitter finish, medium body, not a classic pilsener.  6/3/8/3/13[3.1]

Bottle that I picked up from GBBF 09 and consumed 22-08-09   Pours hazy mid gold with white head. Aroma is strange, bit of sick smell, better once left to settle but still not great. Taste is refreshing, touch lemony and hoppy but not quite the beer I expected.  A4 A3 F7 P3 Ov11  2.8

Bottle @ GBBF 2009. A clear yellow/golden colored beer, with a thick white head. The aroma of malts with fruits and bitter. The taste is hoppy bitter with fruits like citrus. Notes of grass. The aftertaste is dry and bitter and a little sweet. A good pilsener.

Bottle at GBBF 09. Thanks to Phil. Gold with a small white head. Nettly aroma with a bit of barnyard. Grainy taste with a little soapiness. Sharp bitter finish. Another startling, interesting Italian beer.
Bottle.  Sour cherry and barely malt with light hay hops aroma.  Golden yellow color with small head.  Creamy malt flavor with moderate grassy hops finish - very nice beer.

Draft at redlight. Pours a dark golden yellow color with a small, foamy white head that receds quickly and leaves a rings of lacing on the glass. On tap @ Redlight.  Cloudy dark yellow color with a thin broken off-white head.  Smooth chalky floral grain aroma.  Nice smooth taste, light toasty grain notes.  Nice and smooth.

draft @ redlight redlight.  Grassy hops on the nose with hints of sweet malts.  Pours straw blonde with a thick white head.  Light crisp flavor, mellow sweet malts with crisp grassy hops.  Finishes with a nice crisp hoppy finish.  Very nice to drink!

Draft @ redlight redlight. Pours blonde with a tidy white head and lacing out the ying-yang. Grassy/spicy noble hop nose, creamy lightly toasted malts play the background. Draft at Redlight Redlight. Sweet, Ive been waiting for this pils for a long time. The pour yields a very loghtly hazy, medium golden-amber color. UPDATED: JAN 29, 2011 Re-Rate:  I dont know what I was thinking the first time.  This is an elite beer.  One of the best in the world.  Crisp, clean, refreshing and outrageously flavorful for a lighter session brew.  Grassy hops are perfectly portioned.  This beer rocks.
Draft at Redlight Redlight.  Pours a cloudy golden yellow with a white head.  Aroma of strong grain and european hops.  Flavors of hops, grain, lemon and a little bitterness with a dry finish.  Nice pilsener.
Eccellente pilsener italiana,molto aromatica,peccato ne abbia potuto bere poca perchè condivisa.Questa va assaggiata e riassaggiata perchè ne vale veramente la pena.Complimeti al Birrificio!
Draught at Rustico - Crisp light bready flavor.  A moderate  grassy, floral aroma.   An excellent Pilsner.  I would drink this all the time if I could get it often.
750ml lbottle purchased at a Birroteca La Tana del Luppolo in Bologna, Italy for 8.50 eur Excellent.

On tap at BQ, Milan.
Very aromatic. Lots of hoppy dryness, almost oaky. Soft flowers underneath - rose petals? Complex, yet very drinkable beer this would be perfect of an all night session.

Draught at Rustico in Alexandria.   Nearly clear straw body with lots of micro carbonation streams and a creamy, head that leaves ragged sheets of lace.   The aroma has a medium intensity, with dough, bread, crust, honey, flowers, herbs, and grass clippings. Draught at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà, Roma. September 08. Golden with a lasting white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, spices and earthy notes. The flavour is sweet malt and herbal tones from the hops. Crisp and bitter finish. This is a very tasty pilsener.

(draft) Fluffy white head atop cloudy apple juice body.  Aroma is medium sweet, bread, some lemon, light herbal/grass, melon.  Taste is medium sweet, lemon, herbal, some bread. keg at the bat ..golden amber ... soft dry musty rffee nose .. soft dry grassy hop ... soft fruits ..3.0

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2010 In short: On tap it is one of the best session beer I can I have ever had.  In bottle iit is one of the two best pils to come out of a bottle/can (along with Christoffel).
How: Tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà, Rome Italy.  Bottle 750ml, consumed fresh a few weeks after MatinT brought it from Italia. 
The look: Almost clear blonde body topped by a long lasting small fluffy white head.
In long: Nose of lemony meringue and freshly cut grass.  Big body for the style but with no apparent sweetness.  Just a lot of hay and unsweetened cookies.  Light fruity notes of dried bananas and lemon.  Hops, hops and more hops, this one is loaded with hops.  Dry grass with a little spicy touch from start to finish.  Rather dry.  Extra-pleasant dry tasty bitterness.  I never thought the best Classic German Pilsner in a bottle would be from Italia.  Sometimes an Italian decide to do like the Germans and we get a great beer, and sometimes we get Mussolini.

A lot of glasses on the tap, every time I end up by chance near Lurago Marinone... ok, sometimes is not "by chance"...
One word could be enough: wondeful.

Not too strong but really pleasant. Medium-light body and hoppy bitternes dominating but not overwhelming the malty sweetness. It satisfies all the senses and its actually impossible not to have the second.
From bottle at Bruxellensis. Hazy pale golden with a limited head. Intensely grassy hop aroma. Like tasting hay. The ultimate Sauvignon Blanc among beers.

75 cL bottle. Pours slight cloudy orange to yellow with a lacing white head. Aroma is mild spiced and dry grassy to hay-ish. Flavour follows this closely with a unique dry grassy/hay-ish base flavour and with a mild caramel malty sweetness. Delicate fruity accent too and a mild bitterness emerging towards a dry yet light fruity hoppy finish. Nice and tasty pilsner!

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2016 My Bottom Line:
Riveting grassy, herbal hops entertain until the very end as balancing hay provides completion and crispness. This may be a Classic German Pilsener, but it certainly seems to be imbued with a touch of Italian flair.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A bobbing head of foam crowns the hazy blond.
-The frothy, soft effervescence admirably propels all flavors.
-This pils proved to be a tad variable in all pints I had. The first in Rome was very hoppy, almost an extra-hopped version of the style. The second, a couple of days later, proved to be a lot yeastier in the flavor profile. I guess they had gotten towards the end of the keg. The glass at the brewery itself was probably the cleanest and most quintessential example of the style I could imagine. Another pint back in Rome was close to the version at the brewery, but with an added citrusy touch. From 4.4 to 3.8, I have to say all pints were immensely enjoyable.
-The bottle proved to be nearly as pleasant as all tap experiences, and reminded me most of the version I had at the brewery.

On tap at the brewery in Lurago Marinone and at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà, many times, and bottles back home.

My friend Artem bought this for me, other wise I would not have paid the $14 flute price at the Beer Table. On the other hand, the flaws become so evident that it becomes easy to make a bad one.  Well this on is good because there aren’t any flaws.  It pours a thicker shade of golden than one usually sees from a pils.  In general its a slightly sweeter and earthy pils with a slightly thicker body.  Put all those things together and you got something wonderful and extremely quaffable. Highly recommended if you can find it for a better price.

text: Wow...an excellent beer with a lot more flavor than a typical euro pils.  A bit citrus and a touch of hops.  Nice fluffy head as well.  I tried this at the Red Coat Tavern in Royal Oak on tap.  I really enjoyed it...

Draught @ Beer Table, Brooklyn. Pours a hazy dark yellow, fluffy white head that eventually disappears without lacing. Nose is subdued, a bit spicy, herbal hops peek through. Really subtle, a lot going on for a pils. Delicious beer, utterly refreshing. Crisp carbonation, slightly creamy, medium body.

Beautiful head of foam. Spicy hops in the nose, Flavor is crisp & clean, with lots of hop character, hints of lemon and herbs. Finish lasts well. Quite good!

I did not quite score the beer 5/5 when I had it. There are the ones who would accuse me of showing a bias towards a beer that is pretty much impossible to find. Oh sure they are bottling it now, but how can a bottled pilsners that will have travelled hundreds if not thousands of kilometers be compared to the real deal, on tap at the brewery. Those who accuse me may actually be right, Ill never admit it, but chances are that I was carried by the moment. Luckily, they cant sue me as we are not in Italian juridiction. And certainly not in Lurago Marinone, where I was driven by a gentle soul who rightly suspected I would never find the place with my bicycle unless I had a GPS. He was probably right, the indications from small village to small village could not be less clear to decipher. Perhaps this was one of the reason why I enjoyed the beer even more. Or perhaps because it was shared with my significant other who, for some reason, seemed to prefer a vulgar flowery beer named fleurette, while the tipopils had as much floral aromatics as one may wish for. The tipopils, opaque, perfectly balanced, strong in pure hay-like maltiness, almost avoiding any hints at graininess to ensure ultimate leanness, ultimate balance when the coating hop bitterness grabs your soul, grabs your upper and lower lips into a form vaguely similar to what poets at times refer to as a smile. Fresh, focused, cleansing crisp carbonation. Exceptional quality. Firm body, biscuity flavours that grow and grow as it warms, yet keep this quality that one can only describe as delicacy. Yet dry and this was meant to be. Still you will ask me, is it not against some unwritten ratebeer rule to attribute a 5.0 to a pilsner, this vile, lame style for the wussies who, to this day, remain afraid of darkness, who refuse the offer of a thick plot for mere simplicity. Well why do you drink fellow drinker? Are you looking at new ways to make your life more complicated with thick, sweet, long to drink beefy beers? You may as well make it more complicated by seeking this intricate, subtle gem, the quest of which, I promise, will be as complex as any of those fat beers you rave about. As for myself, as I said earlier, I had initially not given this beer a 5, not that anything was really lacking. But the thing is that, to this day, with a backlog now having passed the thousand, I estimate with a sufficient level of confidence that this beer will very likely remain my favorite of this voyage and thus deserve a special pat in the back. Is it worth a five? Some say none are, I say it is as worthy as pretty much any other.

Very tasty Pils.  Perhaps the tastiest Ive had in quite awhile.  Nice hop profile yet incredibly smooth palate make this beer top notch and entirely refreshing.  Italiano has done well again here, nice brewery too.

(Bottle 100 cl) Pours pilsener golden with a slight haze and a neat creamy head with good retention. Quite malty in the nose. Fairly solid body with a very solid malt base and a distinct bitterness. Very solidly crafted - brewpub-style. Thanks to fiulijn for sharing. 120206

A hazy orange beer with a white head - unfiltered pilsener is not right, but for a different style fine. The flavor is sweet malty with strong notes of straw, while the flavor is sweet and very hoppy giving it a fresh grassy note too, besides a more subdued fruitiness, leading to a good bitter end. Great for a pilsener. Huge thanks to Alex (fiulijn) for sharing this seldom gem.

Bottle, thanks to Alex for sharing this.
Hazy yellow coloured with a lasting white head.

Flavour of malts and lots of hops.

1L bottle; big thanks to fiulijn ! - hazy blond colour with a little stable foam, leaving a correct lacing; the nose shows a solid herbal and flowery hoppiness; a clean and soft maltiness introduces a robust bitterness; the finish is very long and dry with a strong aromatic herbal hoppiness meeting the lingering bitterness - balanced and wonderful; I dont think its possible to brew a better pils
